title: Stargazers Cosmic Watchlist
summary: Server-first watchlist for anime, films, TV, and games with analytics, shareable filters, and TMDB/OMDb enrichment.
description: A type-safe watchlist application built with Next.js Server Actions, Zod validation, and Google OAuth. TMDB/OMDb enrichment, shareable URL filters, and an analytics dashboard for completion rates, heatmaps, and genre trends keep it practical while staying server-first.
highlights: Server-first CRUD with Zod validation and Google OAuth handled through Next.js server actions.
Shareable URL filters so watchlists stay bookmarkable and collaborative.
Analytics for completion rates, activity heatmaps, and genre breakdowns.

title: Photon Trail
summary: AI-assisted personal finance dashboard with Plaid bank connections, automated categorization, and spending analytics.
description: Secure Plaid Link flows with NextAuth-protected routes, OpenAI-powered transaction categorization, and responsive dashboards powered by Drizzle/PostgreSQL. Chart.js visuals and guarded APIs keep insights clear without leaking data.
highlights: Plaid Link integration with encrypted tokens and real-time bank sync.
OpenAI-powered categorization to auto-label transactions and surface patterns.
Spending dashboard with Chart.js visuals and protected NextAuth flows.

title: Cosmic Digest
summary: Automated news aggregation with AI relevance scoring, trend detection, and scheduled email digests.
description: A .NET 10 worker that parses RSS feeds, applies OpenAI relevance scoring and topic tagging, surfaces trend signals, and delivers scheduled digests via Mailgun. Dockerized to keep runs consistent across environments.
highlights: OpenAI-driven relevance scoring and topic tagging to filter noisy feeds.
Trend detection and price tracking across sources with alerts.
Dockerized worker pipeline delivering scheduled Mailgun email digests.

title: Cosmic UI
summary: React component library built on Radix primitives with variant-based styling and CSS variable theming.
description: Lightweight, accessible component library published to npm/GitHub Packages. Uses Radix UI primitives, class-variance-authority variants, and CSS variables so teams can theme without rerender cost; built and packaged with tsup and CI automation.
highlights: Radix-based primitives wrapped with variant-driven APIs via class-variance-authority.
CSS variable theming enabling dark/light swaps without recalculating styles.
Automated GitHub Actions publishing with typed, tree-shakeable builds and documentation.
